titleStmt.title: Present remedies against the plague Shewing sundry preseruatiues for the same, by holsome fumes, drinkes, vomits, and other inward receits: as also the perfect cure (by implaisture) of any that are therewith infected. Now necessary to bee obserued of euery housholder, to auoid the infection, lately begun in some places of this cittie. Written by a learned phisition, for the health of his country: and now newly inlarged by the same author, with remedies for the newe pestilent feuer.
Good councell against the plague
titleStmt.author: Learned phisition.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By J. Danter] for VVilliam Barley, and are to be sold at his shop in Gratious streete ouer against Leaden Hall,

notesStmt.note: Originally published in 1592 as: Good councell against the plague.
Running title reads: Good counsell. against the plague.
Identified as STC 20867 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Gratious streete ouer against Leaden Hall
